channel.title: travelling on alexchiri.com
channel.description: Recent content in travelling on alexchiri.com

item.title: Giethoorn
item.description: One of the most picturesque villages I have visited until now in the Netherlands, only for the ones who don’t feel threatened by boats and water. Giethoorn, this village in the province of Overijssel, is often called the Venice of the North and while far from me to make this kind of appreciations (I have never been to Venice, yet), I can say it is definitely one of the objectives you should not miss while in Holland.

item.title: A life protecting barrier for the Rotterdam area
item.description: I have visited recently the Maeslantkering surge barrier in the Hoek van Holland area, near Rotterdam. It is an impressive construction with an important role: to protect lives. But before I tell you more about the barrier, here’s a short introduction about The Delta Project. The reason After the big flood in Jan-Feb 1953 (in Dutch is called watersnoodramp) and the 1836 people who died because of it, things became clear for the Netherlands[1]: they needed to be better prepared for this kind of events.
